TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SamlAuthorityBinding extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies how to retrieve additional information about the subject of a security token.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding> class to specify how to retrieve additional information about an authenticated subject within a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token. <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify when the subject was authenticated. The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements. The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement>. An <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> asserts that the statement's subject was authenticated by a particular means at a particular time. An <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthenticationStatement> also has an optional <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding>, which specifies how to retrieve additional information about an authenticated subject.
Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding.Location%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding.AuthorityKind%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAuthorityBinding.Binding%2A> properties to retrieve additional information about an authenticated subject.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
